author: claravanstaden
content:
I need to set the correct epoch so that our Ethereum light client knows how to handle headers: https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/blob/main/system-parachains/bridge-hubs/bridge-hub-polkadot/src/bridge_to_ethereum_config.rs#L117

To lay out the process:
1. Update the epoch in the code linked above, get the PR merged and the new Polkadot runtime released.
2. Create a referendum for the Polkadot community to vote on the upgrade, e.g. https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/1202?tab=description
3. The community votes on the referendum, can take 2-3 weeks. On successful voting, the upgrade executes.

I realize this might be a unique request and that most of the community might want an earlier upgrade, but I'd ask at least 3 weeks notice if at all possible. üôÇ

author: claravanstaden
content: If the Electra epoch changes, the referendum could just be cancelled.

author: .paulharris
content: We would typically want at least 3 weeks to distribute the message that the upgrade is happening so validators don't get caught out, so I do believe we're fairly aligned in that desire for notice...

author: potuz
content: I think it's becoming clear by the minute that yes, the community wants the fork ASAP but it's practically impossible to ship this with less than a month notice from the public testnet launches. Doing mainnet releases right after the testnets with two weeks notice and having to roll those back with less than a week notice if there's something wrong in the testnet is just crazy. Let alone big node operators have their own slow procedures for upgrading

author: tersec
content:
My position is that I don't deeply care about the exact time interval between these things, but I want:
- `devnet-5` to work, reliably, with all the CLs and ELs;
- `devnet-6` to work, reliably, with all the CLs and ELs; and
- Holesky to work, reliably, with all the CLs and ELs

before committing to a mainnet fork epoch.

author: ajsutton
content: I think it is a very reasonable note that if we expect L2s (and other apps) to have things like enforced upgrade delays and strong governance, L1 upgrades are going to have to give enough notice to let those processes play out.
